instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Can anyone link me to or sell me a <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> for a 3662(2014) 15" MB?
threads.message:
I have a 3662 with a bad <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> and need to find a replacement. After I tried one from a 2012 3115 and didn't work, I was informed by duke that the IC has firmware on it. 
I found a link to some on Aliexpress: [url]https://www.aliexpress.com/wholesale?catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20180501130529&SearchText=CY8C24794[/url]
but I wouldn't know how to program them if it has firmware. It looks like I need a CY8C24794 MLF-1 with Sym version 2, which in schematic shows its the same as the 3115, 2012.

Does anyone have a working 3662 or 3787 with a dead cpu or something and would be willing to sell me the <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> off it? I can pay through paypal or venmo or something.

threads.title: Can anyone link me to or sell me a <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> for a 3662(2014) 15" MB?
threads.message:
What's wrong with buying donor boards?

[URL="https://www.aliexpress.com/wholesale?catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20180501142140&SearchText=<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]https://www.aliexpress.com/wholesale...hText=<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]

Anyway, I have a few if you're in the UK.
I imagine that the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> has the same firmware. I could be wrong but I would have a bet on it.

threads.title: Can anyone link me to or sell me a <CHIP>U4801</CHIP> for a 3662(2014) 15" MB?
threads.message: 3332, 3787, are the same for sure. Get some donor boards, you will always need them.
